definition: to receive favor (from superior)/favored/pampered
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
to love/to pamper/to spoil/to favor
overwhelmed by favor from superior (humble expr.)

sentences.english: I feel flattered by your invitation.
sentences.chinese: 受到你的邀請，我感到受寵若驚。

sentences.english: I didn't know whether to feel flattered or disgusted.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道是否感到受寵若驚或厭惡。

sentences.english: I didn no dat. I'm flattered, ty.
sentences.chinese: 我並不想那麼做，我受寵若驚，謝謝你。

sentences.english: Crumb was the favored jester in the court of Jabba the Hutt.
sentences.chinese: 在赫特人賈巴的宮殿裏，他是受寵的小丑。

sentences.english: When I was little, I didn't feel like I was the favorite.
sentences.chinese: 我很小的時候，並不覺得自己最受寵。

sentences.english: Silk is favorable tribute in feudalistic dynasty, as well as luxury goods in west countries.
sentences.chinese: 絲綢是封建朝廷的受寵貢品，更是風靡西方的奢侈品。

sentences.english: I mean, it's flattering, I guess, but couldn't you have done a little better?
sentences.chinese: 雖然我受寵若驚但你找不到更好的人選？

sentences.english: Bill is anxious to get in the boss's good books.
sentences.chinese: 比爾渴望在老闆那裏受寵。

sentences.english: How spoiled we get here. Makes very little difference.
sentences.chinese: 我們真是受寵若驚，不會有所不同。

sentences.english: But as far as doting wife goes, I think I lack form.
sentences.chinese: 但是作爲一個受寵的妻子，我覺得我做得不夠格。

sentences.english: Everyone treated me so well that I was humbled.
sentences.chinese: 大家對我都很好，我簡直受寵若驚。
“什麼，沒有啊，”丈夫受寵若驚地說。

sentences.english: But some experts believe being less favoured can have positive consequences.
sentences.chinese: 不過一些專家認爲，不受寵也會帶來積極的影響。

sentences.english: At home, Tom is the white-haired boy.
sentences.chinese: 在家中，湯姆是最受寵的人。

sentences.english: It takes time to build the political will to go after a beloved company.
sentences.chinese: 培養追捕一家受寵的公司的政治意願需要時間。

sentences.english: He said he was flattered to hear about the talk in Las Vegas.
sentences.chinese: 他說他爲那些發生在拉斯維加斯的談話感到受寵若驚。

definition: to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
bridal room and ornamented candles/wedding festivities (idiom)
to be a favorite/favor
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
a golden house to keep one's mistress (idiom); a magnificent house built for a beloved woman
imperious/peremptory
pleasure seeking (idiom); life of dissipation
arrogant and despotic
overjoyed at unexpected good news (idiom)
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
completely lacking any feeling or sense of justice (idiom); cold and ruthless
sullen/to scowl miserably
hanging one's head dispiritedly (idiom); dejected/crestfallen
